Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw a specific habitat on land, such as a garden, forest, or playground, with detailed elements of the environment.
The student can illustrate a water habitat, like a pond, stream, or lake, with clear differentiation from land habitats.
The student can include various types of plants, like trees, grasses, or flowers, appropriately placed within their respective habitats.
The student can depict different types of animals, such as lizards, squirrels, or ants, in their suitable land habitat, showing understanding of where these animals live.
The student can illustrate water-dwelling creatures, like fish or clams, in their appropriate water habitat with accuracy.
The student can effectively show in their drawing how living things are different in each habitat, highlighting diversity.
The student can use patterns or other visual elements in their drawing to demonstrate how plant and animal diversity changes across different habitats.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally have minor gaps, such as slightly incomplete labeling of all living things, but this does not affect the overall accuracy of the drawing.
